item.title: Bar Plots in RStudio
item.description: In this plot we will create a bar plot with the Lahman database, dplyr, and ggplot2: First let’s load some packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) Now let’s create a data frame to be able to work with ggplot later. df<-Teams%>% filter(yearID==1980)%>% select(name,HR)%>% arrange(HR) head(df) ## name HR ## 1 New York Mets 61 ## 2 San Diego Padres 67 ## 3 Houston Astros 75 ## 4 San Francisco Giants 80 ## 5 Cleveland Indians 89 ## 6 Chicago White Sox 91 The column name is a character, and we need to make it a factor (category) in order to be able to put the bar plot in order:

item.title: Scatter Plot in Rstudio
item.description: In this class we will learn how to create a scatter plot with the Lahman database, using dplyr, and using ggplot2, with ggiraph to make it interactive. First let’s load some packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Using dplyr, we want to get all the players with 400 or more HR in their careers, and the total amount of SO in their careers. df<-Batting%>% group_by(playerID)%>% summarize(career_HR=sum(HR), career_SO=sum(SO))%>% filter(career_HR>=400 ) df ## # A tibble: 55 x 3 ## playerID career_HR career_SO ## <chr> <int> <int> ## 1 aaronha01 755 1383 ## 2 bagweje01 449 1558 ## 3 bankser01 512 1236 ## 4 beltrad01 445 1584 ## 5 beltrca01 421 1693 ## 6 bondsba01 762 1539 ## 7 cabremi01 446 1516 ## 8 cansejo01 462 1942 ## 9 dawsoan01 438 1509 ## 10 delgaca01 473 1745 ## # .
